Information: The leaf has many therapeutic properties especially its diabetes control, antioxidant and anti-aging properties. It has distinctive flavor and fragrance and it is known be rich in vitamin.Consuming this herbes help to detoxify the body and eliminate harmful toxins.
Procedure:
Decoction Preparation: Boil a handful of fresh Jackfruit leaves in water until the water reduces to about half its original volume to prepare a decoction.

Internal Consumption:Drink the cooled decoction as recommended by an Ayurvedic practitioner. Jackfruit leaf decoction is believed to have various health benefits, including promoting digestion, reducing fever, and relieving diarrhea.It may also be used to treat skin diseases, asthma, and other respiratory issues.

External Use: Jackfruit leaves may also be used externally in the form of a poultice to treat wounds, skin infections, and other skin conditions due to their potential antimicrobial properties. 

Holistic Approach:In Ayurveda, the use of Jackfruit leaves is part of a holistic approach to health and wellness. It aims to balance the body's doshas (bioenergies) and promote overall well-being.
